Now

(Inspired by Derek Siver's /now page movement)

I'm a husband and new dad, to a daughter born in September 2016. Being a dad is very awesome. Seeing a little human grow is the most amazing thing.

When I'm not husband-ing or dad-ing, I'm working full-time at Culture Amp. I am about to start a Junior Engineering Program there, mentoring about 5 junior developers in Ruby and Elixir.

I'm mentoring / advising some juniors outside of work at the moment and share my answers to their questions so that other juniors can read them (and it saves me time having to write them all out again!)

I am writing Joy of Elixir in my free time. This book is a gentle introduction to programming for first-timers, teaching them the ways of Elixir. Why I'm writing it is best explained by it about page.

I'm the current Secretary of Ruby Australia. This mostly involves keeping minutes for the association's committee meetings, but also involves some light paperwork and other duties.

I've quit maintaining my open source projects, but you might see me dabble around here and there.
